problem_text:
Do there exist Golod groups all of whose abelian subgroups have finite ranks?
Here a Golod group means a finitely generated non-nilpotent subgroup of the adjoint
group of a nil-ring. The answer is negative for the whole adjoint group of a nil-ring
(Ya. P. Sysak, Abstracts of the 17th All–Union Algebraic Conf., part 1, Minsk, 1983,
p. 180 (Russian)).
A. I. Sozutov
